Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393369) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393369)
